title: Rosetta Stone will help you on your summer travel and it’s more than $100 off now
content:
Macworld

Over the past 30 years, legions have turned to Rosetta Stone when they needed to learn a new language. Now with summer travel plans rounding into shape, it’s a good time to get a jump on learning the native language of your faraway vacation destinations.

Honored as PC Magazine’s Editors’ Choice Award for the Best Language-Learning Software five years in a row, Rosetta Stone has got the intricacies of mastering a new language down to a science.

With their intuitive, immersive training method, learners start with simple lessons like matching games to get familiar with keywords and phrases. From there, they ramp up quickly to grammar and pronunciation so reading, writing, and speaking skills all develop organically.

Meanwhile, Rosetta Stone’s TruAccent speech recognition technology analyzes the words you say at a pace of 100 words per second, evaluating everything from your understanding to whether your accent will blend in with the locals.

The Wall Street Journal said, “Rosetta Stone… may be the next best thing to living in a country.” And with 25 languages available in this lifetime bundle, you could effectively hopscotch the globe and always feel like you’re getting the true flavor and experience of a foreign land.

A lifetime subscription to Rosetta Stone’s complete language collection is usually $299, but is on sale now for $189.99.
